org.arl.fjage

Class WakerBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.arl.fjage.Behavior
      • org.arl.fjage.WakerBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Behavior>

    public class WakerBehavior
extends Behavior
    A behavior that is executed once after a specified delay. Once the specified delay expires, the onWake() method of this behavior is called.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.arl.fjage.Behavior

        action, agent, log

      Creates a behavior which is executed once after a specified delay.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void action()
      This method calls onWake() when the specified delay for this behavior expires.
      static WakerBehavior create(long millis, java.lang.Runnable runnable)
      Creates a new WakerBehavior which runs the specified Runnable once the specified delay expires.
      boolean done()
      Returns false until the delay expires, and true once the delay has expired and the onWake() method has been called.

      This method should return a number that denotes the priority of a behavior.

      Terminates the behavior.

    • Method Detail

      • getWakeupTime

        public final long getWakeupTime()
        Returns the wakeup time for this behavior. On a real-time platform, the time is the epoch time, while a discrete event simulator gives the wakeup time in simulated time.
        Returns:
        the wakeup time in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        Platform.currentTimeMillis()

      • stop

        public final void stop()
        Terminates the behavior.

      • onWake

        public void onWake()
        This method is called once the specified delay for this behavior expires. A behavior usually overrides this.

      • onStart

        public final void onStart()
        Computes the wakeup time for this behavior.
        Overrides:
        onStart in class Behavior
        See Also:
        Behavior.onStart()

      • action

        public final void action()
        This method calls onWake() when the specified delay for this behavior expires.
        Overrides:
        action in class Behavior
        See Also:
        Behavior.action()

      • done

        public final boolean done()
        Returns false until the delay expires, and true once the delay has expired and the onWake() method has been called.
        Overrides:
        done in class Behavior
        Returns:
        false when the delay has not expired, false after it has expired.
        See Also:
        Behavior.done()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the behavior, allowing it to be used again.
        Overrides:
        reset in class Behavior
        See Also:
        Behavior.reset()

      • getPriority

        public int getPriority()
        Description copied from class: Behavior
        This method should return a number that denotes the priority of a behavior. By default, the priority is 0. Behaviors with lower priority values are executed before behaviors with higher priority values.
        Overrides:
        getPriority in class Behavior
        Returns:
        priority value
